document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Li, Tong & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part IV: the ornata species group from the East Asia, with morphological and molecular evidence (II)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part IV: the ornata species group from the East Asia, with morphological and molecular evidence (II)

bibRefCitation.author: Okada
bibRefCitation.refString: Okada, H. (1968) Addition to the fauna of the family Drosophilidae of Japan and adjacent countries (Diptera: Drosophilidae). Kontyu, Tokyo, 36, 303 - 323.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Wing R 2 + 3 vein without patch apically in male (
Fig. 2
E, F); paramere nearly triangular, broad basally, acute apically (
Fig. 22
C); aedeagus slender, nearly entirely pubescent (
Fig. 22
D).

Description. Ocellar triangle yellowish brown, with 3–5 setae above ocellar setae. Frons brownish to brown. Pedicel brown; first flagellomere yellow. Clypeus dark brown. Palpus brownish yellow. Mesonotum yellowish brown, brown before scutellum (
Fig. 6
C). Postpronotal lobe brownish (
Fig. 6
D). Acrostichal setulae in 14–16 irregular rows (
Fig. 6
C). Scutellum yellowish brown to brown, black along margin (
Fig. 6
C). Pleura with a brown, longitudinal stripe above (
Fig. 6
D). Katepisternum and mesopleuron mostly brownish yellow (
Fig. 6
D). Wing (
Fig. 2
E, F): Costal vein between R 2 + 3 and R 4 + 5 distally with 5–7 peg-like spinules on ventral surface. Abdominal tergites dark brown, with yellow patches (
Fig. 10
F). Male terminalia: Epandrium with pubescence and 10 setae near posterior and ventral margin per side (
Fig. 22
A). Paramere nearly triangular, lacking pubescence, with 7 sensilla distally (
Fig. 22
C).

Specimens examined. CHINA :
